meanings.definition: The state of being adjacent or next to something else.
meanings.sent1: The adjacence of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The adjacence of the park to the school allowed for quick and easy access to outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The adjacence of the cat to the fishbowl led to an unexpected friendship.
meanings.sent4: The adjacence of the mountains to the valley created a breathtaking landscape.
meanings.sent5: The adjacence of the colors red and green made the painting vibrant and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: The quality of being close or near in proximity.
meanings.sent1: The adjacence of the two shops made it convenient for customers to visit both in one trip.
meanings.sent2: The adjacence of the bus stop to the office building saved commuters time in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The adjacence of the ice cream shop to the gym posed a tempting dilemma for the fitness enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The adjacence of the stars in the night sky created a sense of wonder and awe.
meanings.sent5: The adjacence of the flavors in the dish made it a harmonious blend of tastes.
